snippet: Having both declined public money, President Obama and Mitt Romney are committing to ambitious fund-raising schedules that are eating into valuable campaign time.
abstract: Pres Obama and Mitt Romney, having both declined public money, are committing to ambitious fund-raising schedules that are eating into valuable campaign time in the hotly-contested race; candidates are hoping to have raised more than three-quarters of a billion dollars by Election Day, target that will require each to raise well over $100 million in September and in October.

byline.original: By NICHOLAS CONFESSORE and ASHLEY PARKER

lead_paragraph: Having both declined public money, President Obama and Mitt Romney are committing to ambitious fund-raising schedules that are eating into valuable campaign time.

headline.seo: Romney and Obama Juggle Campaigning and Fund-Raising
headline.main: Candidates Look to Balance Need for Campaigning With Need for Money
headline.print_headline: Candidates Look to Balance Need for Campaigning With Need for Money
